results.title: Muriel's Wedding
results.creator_credit: Jill Bilcock, P.J. Hogan, Jocelyn Moorhouse, Lynda House, Peter Szabo and Associates, Film Victoria and House and Moorhouse Films
results.brief_description: Muriel is a dag, an Abba maniac and an out of place girl who would give anything to be like her nasty friends. In her hunt to find Mr. Right in all the wrong places, Muriel takes a one-way ticket to freedom to find herself.

constellations_other.name: Jill Bilcock
constellations_other.description: An editor’s work often goes unnoticed, but their scene-stitching not only brings the director’s vision to life but sometimes steals the show. One of Australia’s greatest editors, Jill Bilcock, has shaped some of the country’s most memorable screen stories.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Jill Bilcock, P.J. Hogan, Jocelyn Moorhouse, Lynda House, Peter Szabo and Associates, Film Victoria and House and Moorhouse Films
results.description:
Muriel is a dag, an Abba maniac and an out-of-place girl who would give anything to be like her nasty friends. In her hunt to find Mr. Right in all the wrong places, Muriel takes a one-way ticket to freedom to find herself. A bittersweet and much acclaimed film that touches on themes of self-respect, identity and friendship.

Toni Collette gives an inspired performance as Muriel and the supporting cast includes Bill Hunter, Sophie Lee, Jeanie Drynan and Rachel Griffiths.

results.title: The Sentimental bloke
results.creator_credit: F.W. Thring and Efftee Film Productions
results.brief_description: Based on the poem by Bill and Doreen’s courtship, marriage and move to the country, this version of C.J.Dennis’ verse narrative adds subplot in which Bill saves Doreen’s Uncle Jim from an attempted swindle. Stars Cecil Scott Ray Fisher, Tal Ordell and Athol Tier.

results.title: The War of the worlds
results.creator_credit: Byron Haskin, George Pal and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: H.G. Wells’ classic tale about the invasion of the Earth by Martians has inspired and terrified people for many decades. Its translation into film was even more frightening, as audiences felt the panic and saw the destruction, as Martian machines, swan-shaped, ticking and hissing menacingly, destroyed everything in their path. In order to modernise Well’s ideas, the original story was updated to include the atom bomb; ineffectual against the Martians. The film won an Academy Award for special effects. Staring Gene Barry, Ann Robinson and Les Tremayne.

results.title: The Princess and the cobbler
results.creator_credit: Richard Williams, Richard Sutton, Imogen Sutton and Allied Filmmakers
results.brief_description: Set in a faraway land of magnificent palaces and beautiful Princesses, a sly thief, a shy cobbler and some very ugly brigands, do battle with an evil sorcerer to save a kingdom and rescue a beautiful princess. Following the tradition of “Aladdin” and “Ali Baba”, this animation is exciting family entertainment, with a wonderful musical score featuring the voices of Bobbi Page and Steve Lively, from “Beauty and the beast” and Vincent Price as the evil Zig Zag.

results.title: Total recall
results.creator_credit: Paul Verhoeven, Ronald Shusett, Buzz Feitshans, Carrolco and Tri-Star Pictures
results.brief_description: Set in the year 2084, “Total Recall” tells the story of Doug Quaid who after having strange dream about Mars, visits a travel service called Rekall Inc. which implants artificial vacation memories into their clients’ brains. In Quaid’s case, the process goes horribly wrong and he discovers that his life on earth is an illusion, and that his real persona once lived on Mars. The film follows Quaid’s search for his identity and the unravelling of the mystery which surrounds his life. Starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Sharon Stone, Ronny Cox, this film has exceptional special effects, and is based on a story by renowned science fiction writer Phillip K. Dick.

results.title: Eureka
results.creator_credit: Nicolas Roeg, Jeremy Thomas, Recorded Picture Company and J F Productions
results.brief_description: This is the dramatic story of the anticlimactic life of a greedy gold prospector after he has struck it rich. Gene Hackman performs with credit as a man whose jackpot fortune leaves him bored, surly and paranoid of being exploited by everybody, including his family. Jane Lapotaire plays his alcoholic wife and Theresa Russell his woman-daughter who rebelliously marries a man her father sees only as a merciless fortune hunter. This is an unforgettable tale of the illusory nature of power and the all-consuming violence of possession - whether it be of love or gold. Based on a book by Marshall Houts.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nicolas Roeg, Jeremy Thomas, Recorded Picture Company and J F Productions

results.title: Much ado about nothing
results.creator_credit: Kenneth Branagh, Stephen Evans, David Parfitt, Samuel Goldwyn and Renaissance Films
results.brief_description: Once again Branagh has successfully brought Shakespeare to modern audiences in a way which will inspire and enthuse even those unfamiliar with the plays. “Much ado about nothing” is a romantic comedy which is full of energy, largely due to its inspired casting. The idyllic Italian countryside is the setting for the story of Hero and Claudio, a young couple whose impending marriage is thrown into jeopardy when Claudio is deceived by his brother Don John. Kenneth Branagh, Emma Thompson, Robert Sean Leonard, Denzel Washington, Keanu Reeves, Kate Beckinsale, Brian Blessed and Richard Briers star in this delightful adaptation while Michael Keaton and Ben Elton in cameos, steal the film with their brilliant comic caricatures.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kenneth Branagh, Stephen Evans, David Parfitt, Samuel Goldwyn and Renaissance Films

results.title: What price glory?
results.creator_credit: John Ford, Sol Siegel and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: John Ford’s colourful screen adaptation of Maxwell Anderson and Laurence Stalling’s raucous army comedy. James Cagney plays Captain Flagg, a hard-boiled leader of a company of US Marines stationed in France during the World War I. Dan Dailey plays the quirky newly arrived Sergeant Quirk and it is not long before the two of them are at loggerheads. When the beautiful Charmaine (Corrine Calvert) becomes the object of their attentions, the war is really on. Watch for a young Robert Wagner in one of his early screen roles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Ford, Sol Siegel and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation

results.title: Mr and Mrs Bridge
results.creator_credit: James Ivory, Ismail Merchant and Cineplex Odeon Films in association with Miramax
results.brief_description: Naive, prudish, yet sweet and endearing, India Bridge (Joanna Woodward) devotes every waking moment to her family. She has no understanding of current affairs because that’s Walter’s (Paul Newman) domain - he knows everything and he’s never wrong. That’s Mr and Mrs. Bridge, or is it? As their children mature and discover boys, girls, sex and silliness, India and Walter suddenly face challenging issues. When Mrs. Bridge decides to show that she is more than a doormat, her new-found independence sparks a heartwarming journey for the whole family - from curious moments, to crisis after amusing crisis. Co-starring Blythe Danner, Simon Callow, Kyra Sedgwick, Robert Sean Leonard, Margaret Welsh, Austin Pendleton and Saundra McClain. Based on the novels “Mr Bridge” and “Mrs Bridge” by Evan S. Connell.

results.title: The Snapper
results.creator_credit: Stephen Frears, Lynda Myles and BBC Film Unit
results.brief_description: The Curley’s are a working class Dublin family headed by Dessie, (Colm Meaney), an affable plasterer with a taste for the drink, and Kay, (Ruth McCabe), who keeps their six children in line. This topsy-turvy household falls into a tailspin when 20 year-old Sharon, (Tina Kellegher) announces that she is pregnant. Tensions mount when it becomes obvious that she has no intention of revealing the child’s paternity. As the time approaches for the little “snapper’ to be born, Dessie is becoming a New Age Man while Sharon learns to turn life’s little “accidents’ into big achievements. This is a delightful Irish comedy, well handled by director Frears and with quality performances by Meany and Kellegher.
